verses.roman:
ārabhyatāṁ dhanur-yāgaś
caturdaśyāṁ yathā-vidhi
viśasantu paśūn medhyān
bhūta-rājāya mīḍhuṣe

synonyms: ārabhyatām—should be commenced; dhanuḥ-yāgaḥ—the bow sacrifice; caturdaśyām—on the fourteenth day of the month; yathā-vidhi—in accordance with Vedic injunctions; viśasantu—offer in sacrifice; paśūn—animals; medhyān—which are fit to be offered; bhūta-rājāya—to Lord Śiva, the lord of ghostly spirits; mīḍhuṣe—the giver of benedictions.
translation: Commence the bow sacrifice on the Caturdaśī day in accordance with the relevant Vedic injunctions. In ritual slaughter offer the appropriate kinds of animals to the magnanimous Lord Śiva.
